Can only spending on dining. But how to get $80 cashback?Dining is 5% cashback so if u spend $800 solely on dining  u only get 40$ cashback.Also be sure to check that the dining MCC u are patronising is coded 5812. 5813 (bars) and 5814 (fast food) are NOT eligible for 5% cashback  only 0.25%. Some you may think is not fast food (eg. Sushi express) but is coded as 5814  so be very sure to check
I think you meant 5812  5813 and 5814

Seeking the power of internet  does anyone know how to negotiate with the restaurant owner that we want to pay for a banquet using credit card instead of pay now? He mentioned there’s bank charges of 5% if we were to use credit card and not sure how true is that… hope anyone with a kind heart could help enlighten me 🥹
Yes cc have charges which merchant can chose either to absorb or not

It's true that vendors have to pay a transaction fee for credit card payments. Officially  they cannot claw back these charges from the customer  but it is perfectly within their right not to accept credit card payments. Unfortunately  there is nothing you can do but depend on the goodwill of the vendor.

Hello  I would like to ask a question regarding REIT.I bought 400 units of Fraser back in 2023 at 2.35  but it was diluted to 2.12 in today's price. I still only have 400 units even though the price is diluted. Does it mean I automatically lose 2.35-2.12 per unit from this dilution?The dilution usually happens when they want to raise money and buy new properties  but why my part of the share will take the lost from the purchase of new properties?
hello  uob prvi & dbs vantage good cards to sign for miles bonus? i have wedding banquet to pay for so min spend of 4k for each card should not be a problem.just wanna check if the rewards are worth

I will recommend DBS Vantage if you can spend about $60k per annum since the AF is high ($599.50) and it is generally not easy to waive unless you hit the spend of $60k. First year is not free and the AF needs to be paid.You do get some nice benefits for the Vantage like Accor Plus membership (Free 1 hotel night stay) with 10 PP uses.Otherwise  go PriviMiles.Incidentally both cards are mainly used for iPayMy and CardUp. If you use those facilities  both cards are awesome.Edit: if you are new to either bank  consider DBS Women’s card or UOB PPV or UOB VS. Those are 4mpd cards which are more attractive vs 1.5mpd (Vantage) and 1.4mpd (Privi)

Probably to make it consistent with the existing marathon promo.All bonus interest credited by 20th of next month.Last time scb was messy. They paid the bonus (only incremental amount) at the start of next month then the shortfall by 20th.
Yes based on principal amount. But u also collected the reit distribution for the period too.
